menu

Class Menu

  • java.lang.Object
    • menu.Menu

  • public class Menu
extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Menu.MENUSTATE
      used to track state of game and change what gets rendered; enum: only 1 state can be true at a time.
      static class  Menu.SELECTED
      determines what menu option is currently selected by the user "selected" options will light up

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        this method is called automatically by GameSystem use this method to update variables continuously this method will be called exactly 30 times per second.

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        this method draws stuff. this method will only activate when GameSystem.state is set to MENU this method will be called continuously. NOTE: if you need to update a variable for example: update a position variable every time the game loop finish, do it in tick() because tick() is designed to be ran 60 times per second, and if it lags during intense times, it will be ran bonus times later to make up for the lack of update. on the other hand, the render method has no restrictions on how many times it's ran per second.
        Parameters:
        g - current graphic

      • renderSelected

        public void renderSelected(java.awt.Graphics g)
        this method simply filters what to draw out based on the current Menu.SELECTED state
        Parameters:
        g - current graphic

      • renderCurrentState

        public void renderCurrentState(java.awt.Graphics g)
        change what is render based on the current MENUSTATE
        Parameters:
        g - current graphic

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(int key)
        detects user keyboard input. the parameter "key" is passed down from GameSystem.keyPressed
        Parameters:
        key - key pressed on the keyboard

      • toStoryMode

        public static void toStoryMode()
        switch to story mode
